greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Length of longest contiguous block of 0's in binary expansion of n^3.
comment: a(n) >= 3*A007814(n). Conjecture: if n < 2^k then a(n) < 3*k. - _Robert Israel_, Mar 10 2020
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) <= 3*A070939(n) - 3 for n > 0. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 10 2020
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(r,k,t=n^3); for(i=0,exponent(t), if(bittest(t,i), k=0, k++>r, r=k)); if(n, r, 1) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 10 2020
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 20 2003
